long_desc.thetext:
The new version of the demobrowser looks very clean, but has lost much of its useful functionality. Even with my many years of qooxdoo development, I still look to the many demos in the demobrowser for examples of how to do things. Furthermore, when I'm answering questions for people on the mailing list, I will point them to the appropriate demobrowser demo as an example of how to do what they're asking. Today I tried to do that and found the relevant demo gone; I had to point them to the "current" rather than "devel" tree, and that tree will disappear entirely with the next release.
I appreciate the clean-up of the demobrowser, but please put back all of the previous demos, possibly under a closed-by-default "advanced" tree branch.
Derrell

Derrell, those demos have not been removed, they are just hidden after startup in the current trunk version of the demobrowser, which features a filtering by name or tag. I asked Martin already to relax the filtering at startup, which currently isn't prominent enough.
I removed the startup filter (r 20973) to make all demos visible again. With the decision of building a separate showcase app, we can now use the demobrowse more as an development tool again.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
